headline.main: From Earth to the Moon and Back, for More Bows

results.snippet: DAVE SCOTT, one of 12 people who have walked on the moon, talks about movies and mini-series as if he were at the joy stick of a lunar lander maneuvering for a good place to set down. '' 'Apollo 13' was vertically integrated,'' he said. '' 'From the...
results.lead_paragraph: DAVE SCOTT, one of 12 people who have walked on the moon, talks about movies and mini-series as if he were at the joy stick of a lunar lander maneuvering for a good place to set down. '' 'Apollo 13' was vertically integrated,'' he said. '' 'From the Earth to the Moon' was horizontal.'' Mr. Scott sees a movie as focusing on a facet or two and then delving deeply. With more time to spend, a mini-series spills outward into the nooks and crannies, spreading itself more thinly but covering more ground.

results.abstract: Software developers create array of new products for girls, but most of it involves blatant steretypes and offers little in way of intellectual and creative challenges; photos (M)
results.snippet: WHAT a difference a few years can make.    In 1995, the conspicuous absence of products for girls in the world of computer software had academic researchers and marketing managers alike gnashing their teeth over the problem.
results.lead_paragraph: WHAT a difference a few years can make. In 1995, the conspicuous absence of products for girls in the world of computer software had academic researchers and marketing managers alike gnashing their teeth over the problem.

results.abstract: Listing of new offerings for 1998-99 television season (M)
results.snippet: NEW SERIES    ABC     THE HUGHLEYS -- A successful African-American businessman moves with his family to an all-white suburb and feels out of place with neighbors and with his old inner-city friends. Some treacherous race-based humor, but the star,...
results.lead_paragraph: NEW SERIES ABC THE HUGHLEYS -- A successful African-American businessman moves with his family to an all-white suburb and feels out of place with neighbors and with his old inner-city friends. Some treacherous race-based humor, but the star, D. L. Hughley, has lived this material and explored it in his stand-up comedy act, so he may be able to get away with the broader touches. Tuesdays at 8:30, starting Sept. 22.

results.abstract: Gerhard Schroder and his Social Democratic Party are running one of slickest and most American-style political advertising campaigns ever in Germany; media drive combines cozy images of happy Germany and edgy criticism of Chancellor Helmut Kohl; marks major departure from dull and didactic fare typical of German campaigns; contrasts with Kohl's old-school ads; photos (M)

headline.main: German Socialists Turn From Slogans to Jingles

results.snippet: Until recently, Detmar Karpinski's biggest accomplishment was advertising Lucky Strike cigarettes. Today, he is producing one of the slickest and most American-style political advertising campaigns that Germany has ever seen.    Hired by the Social...
results.lead_paragraph: Until recently, Detmar Karpinski's biggest accomplishment was advertising Lucky Strike cigarettes. Today, he is producing one of the slickest and most American-style political advertising campaigns that Germany has ever seen. Hired by the Social Democratic Party and its candidate for Chancellor, Gerhard Schroder, Mr. Karpinski as created a media campaign that is an artful dance between cozy images of a happy Germany and edgy criticism of Chancellor Helmut Kohl.

results.abstract: 20th Ironman Triathlon begins on shores of Waikiki, Hawaii; nearly 1,500 triathletes are competing; photo (M)

headline.main: Ironman Triathlon Grows; It's Now 20 and Still Bragging

results.snippet: On that February morning in 1978, only 15 sets of footprints dotted the shores of Waikiki. To every man fit and brave enough to take the challenge went three sheets of paper listing a few rules and a course description.    Scrawled on the last sheet...
results.lead_paragraph: On that February morning in 1978, only 15 sets of footprints dotted the shores of Waikiki. To every man fit and brave enough to take the challenge went three sheets of paper listing a few rules and a course description. Scrawled on the last sheet of paper were these words: ''Swim 2.4 miles! Bike 112 miles! Run 26.2 miles! Brag for the rest of your life!''

results.abstract: Peter Marks reviews Signature Theater Co performance of John Guare's play Marco Polo Sings a Solo; photo (M)

headline.main: Alienation on an Iceberg Where Anger Is Warmth

results.snippet: ''Marco Polo Sings a Solo'' begins with an astronaut adrift among the stars, which is as apt a metaphor as any for this hyperbolic satire from the pen of John Guare. Like a space capsule on the fritz, the play gets stuck in perpetual orbit, floating...
results.lead_paragraph: ''Marco Polo Sings a Solo'' begins with an astronaut adrift among the stars, which is as apt a metaphor as any for this hyperbolic satire from the pen of John Guare. Like a space capsule on the fritz, the play gets stuck in perpetual orbit, floating somewhere out there, high above our heads. Mr. Guare prefigured the millennium craze when he wrote the play in 1977 and set it in 1999, on the cusp of the new century. It's weirdly prophetic in several jarring instances, with references, for example, to the ubiquity of videocassettes, Middle East detente and even a sex scandal in the White House.
